text: [Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is raghavindra and i am
from the aws office here in hyderabad
today i am going to show you
how to resolve the error party fatal
error when trying to access your amazon
elastic compute cloud linux instance
so let's get started
the error party fatal error occurs if
you're not connecting with the
appropriate username for your ami when
you negotiate an ssh session
with the ec2 linux instance r
you're using a wrong private key when
you establish an ssh session with your
ec2 linux instance
you get this error when you connect to
your ec2 linux instance by using ssh
using party client
let's look at both these scenarios and
then see how to resolve them
let's try to connect to our easy to
linux instance using putty and observe
the first error message as you can see
we receive the error message which tells
us
we have the wrong username when
connecting to the ec2 instance
to resolve this issue you must verify
that you are connecting with an
appropriate username to your ec2
instance
each linux instance launches with the
default linux system user account
the default username is determined by
the ami that was specified when you
launched the instance
the following is the list of correct
user names for different linux amis
because my instance is running on amazon
linux to ami i'll use ec2 user as the
username to connect to my instance as
you can see
i am able to login to my ec2 instance
using the correct username now let's
review the second error message
as you can see this time we get the
party fatal error error message
that there are no authentication methods
available
now this error is very generic and can
occur due to multiple reasons
for the scope of this video i'll talk
about two reasons that are associated
with the ssh key pair file
from the client end that are causing
this issue the first one is the correct
key pair file associated with the ec2
instance and second
is the correct format of the key pair
file to check the correct key pair file
name log into your aws account
open the amazon ec2 console and then
choose instances
find the ec2 instance that you want to
connect to using ssh
under the details in the keypair name
column verify the name of the private
key that you are using to connect
through ssh
by default amazon ec2 presents user with
a dot pem key file to download as the
ssh private key upon creation of the key
party doesn't natively support the
private key format dot pem generated by
amazon ec2 this means that you must
verify that you converted your private
key
dot pem file to the format recognized by
putty.ppk
note that as you can see the dot ppk
file used to log in was different from
its dot pem equivalent that you saw in
the ec2 console i have given the same
name to the dot pam and the dot ppk
files to avoid confusion now after
selecting the correct dot ppk file i can
log in to my ec2 instance without any
issues
this error can also occur when using a
private key file other than the ppk file
format
let's check this quickly when i select a
dot pem file
directly to login to my ec2 instance by
using putty i get the same error this
means that we must make sure to properly
convert the private key file which is in
the dot pem format to the format
recognized by putty which is dot ppk
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Applause]
[Music]
